entry.title: Error updating API specification in SAP Build Process Automation Action Project
entry.content:
Hi, I have a SAP CAP service exposing some entities, actions and functions. The service is deployed to BTP subaccount and SAP BPA is enabled. A destination representing the CAP service is also created with additional properties configured for usage in BPA.

I created an Action Project in BPA so I can consume the CAP service actions and functions, I am able to view the endpoints for these when I give the path /odata/v4/workflow in the Resource field. I am then also able to create an Action and test it fine.

However, I then added another function import to the CAP service and deployed it to BTP. In the Action project in BPA, I clicked on the Update API Specification button so it can get the new function, but instead it throws an error.

The Resource Path is also correctly maintained in the Project settings:

The destination details for the CAP service are as follows:

 

 

Why is it that the Update API Specification throws an error when I was able to consume an action from the same service and destination for the first time ?

Regards,

Melwyn

R3nwo

entry.title: Re: Transporting standard task classification
entry.content:
Links to the above two SAP notes:

  • 73318 - Q&A: Transport of workflow objects - SAP for Me
    • Settings - Transport connection
    • Via the table T77TR (IMG path: "Tools" - "Block infotypes against import"), individual combinations of object type - infotype - subtype can be blocked in the target system against import, that is, against overwriting by transported infotype records.
    • The automatic transport connection for tasks can be switched on and off by setting the FOLDEN flag in table T77S0. (IMG path: "Tools" - "PD - Set up transport connection") :
      TRSP CORR X Transport flag (x = no transport)
    • Via the report RHMOVE30, there is the option to transport any tasks without a previous backup ("Manual transport connection"), in particular when the automatic transport connection is deactivated.
  • 138411 - Collective note: PD Transports - SAP for Me
    • Q&A about problems with transports of PD objects (objects of organization management, personnel development, and training and event management) as well as activity groups (Release 3.1 up to and including 4.0) and workflow tasks.
    • It doesn't contain any information about the table T77S0.

entry.title: Re: mass change goal plan status
entry.content:
if you want to avoid creating form to route Goal plans from state A to state B, you have to maintain 2 Goal plan xml with different default goal plan state:                             - goal plan xml - Goal Plan locked where there is a single Goal Plan State configured as default and permission is set to ReadOnly for required roles

               - goal plan xml - Goal Plan unlocked where there is a single Goal Plan State configured as default and permission is set to Create / Update for required roles

entry.title: How to show Current vs Previous Month-Year values with two independent filters in SAC?
entry.content:
I have a requirement in SAP Analytics Cloud where a table needs to show Current Month and Previous Month values side by side.

Currently, I use a single month_year filter. For example, if the user selects June 2025, the table displays:

  • Current Month = June 2025

  • Previous Month = May 2025

However, the client wants two separate filters:

  • One filter for Current Month-Year (e.g., June 2025)

  • Another filter for Previous Month-Year (e.g., May 2024)

This way, the user can choose any two periods independently (even across different years), and the table should display:

  • Current Value: June 2025

  • Previous Value: May 2024

  • Difference: June 2025 – May 2024

Data Source: SAP ECC 

Is it possible to design such functionality in SAC stories (e.g., via input controls, variables, or restricted measures)? If yes, what would be the best approach?

entry.title: Business Transformation Management Value Map Has Moved to SAP Community
entry.content:
We’d like to share some important news regarding SAP ENTERPRISE SUPPORT - BUSINESS TRANSFORMATION MANAGEMENT VALUE MAP

 

What is Business Transformation Management Value Map?

the value map is your structured guide to exploring, onboarding, adopting and effectively using SAP LeanIX and SAP Signavio solutions. It connects you with curated learning content, expert insights, and tailored recommendations. Whether you're looking to build skills, streamline operations, or drive continuous innovation, the Value Map offers practical tools, value accelerators, and hands-on advisory services to help you succeed.


Best of all, access to the Value Map is included in your SAP LeanIX and/or SAP Signavio subscription at no extra cost!!!

 

To provide an even better experience, We have moved to a new home on SAP Community!

What does this mean for you?

  • Easier access – no more switching between SAP platforms.
  • More connected experience – collaborate directly with peers and SAP experts in SAP Community.
  • Same trusted features – including curated content, guided learning paths, and the Request a Call option to connect with our experts.

 

What you need to do

👉Simply visit our new SAP Community page for more information and to get access.

To access the Business Transformation Management Value Map Group, you must login to SAP Community with an S-user ID or a Universal ID.

➡️ Watch our short demo video

 

Don’t Miss Value Maps on SAP Community Live Session!

Join our live session to explore Value Maps on SAP Community:

📅  October 22, 2025

🎥 Live Session: SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps – Our Move to SAP Community

Can’t make it? Don’t worry – a replay will be available.

 

About the author:   

Petr Venhuda is the Portfolio Manager and Topic Expert of SAP Enterprise Support value maps, specializing in Business Transformation Management and Business Process Improvement. With 18 years of experience at SAP and a background spanning roles in Customer Service & Delivery, Petr is passionate about helping customers succeed through SAP Enterprise Support offerings. 

Have questions or feedback around this content? Don’t hesitate to comment down below.

entry.title: moving/rolling sum for specific amount of dates in SAC
entry.content:
Hello community,

I have a requirement to calculate a rolling sum over 7 days in this case. And I want to visualize this value over time in a chart.

Here is an example of how the calculation should look like:

Datesales7 day sum
01.09.2025125125
02.09.2025100225
03.09.202575300
04.09.2025250550
05.09.2025100650
06.09.20253501000
07.09.20252751275
08.09.20251501300
09.09.20251001300
10.09.20251101335

The calculation function for running total does not really work here, because of the missing option to restrict the time period to 7 days. I have also tried this formula: ResultLookup([sales] ;[date]= PREVIOUS(90; "DAY";[date]))  but unfortunately the system does not allow the function PREVIOUS to be used in this context. 

I am using an analytical model from SAP Datasphere as source.

Does anybody know a solution to this problem?

entry.title: SAP Cloud ALM - Move to a existing Global-& Subaccount
entry.content:
Hello

we are facing following situation after having activated/provisioned SAP CALM

  • Makes it technical sense to move a provisioned SAP Cloud ALM to an existing Global/Subaccount or
    must the SAP CALM always be provisioned in its own and exclusively for SAP CALM designated Global/Subaccount?
  • During activation we followed the advice within the wizard an have given unique subdomain-name ending with -cloudalm.
    Is it possible to map a Custom Domain and where to is ot to be configuren within CALM?

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud ALM - Move to a existing Global-& Subaccount
entry.content:
Dear customer,

Q: Makes it technical sense to move a provisioned SAP Cloud ALM to an existing Global/Subaccount or
must the SAP CALM always be provisioned in its own and exclusively for SAP CALM designated Global/Subaccount?

A: 3152095 Why is a new Global Account created when provisioning SAP Cloud ALM?

Customers receive an entitlement to SAP Cloud ALM based on the existence of other specific contracts/purchased solutions connected with their Customer number. The SAP Cloud ALM entitlement also comes with "fair use" rights for memory etc. which are provided free of charge. 

These unique factors require a separate "contract" to be established specifically for SAP Cloud ALM which is separated from the other contracts that the Customer pays for. This is achieved by creating a separate SAP Cloud ALM Global Account in the BTP cockpit during the SAP Cloud ALM provisioning process.

It is currently not possible to bypass this requirement and create a new Sub account in an existing (main) Global Account for the deployment of SAP Cloud ALM. The behaviour of creating a new Global Account during SAP Cloud ALM provisioning is intended by design, based on the factors outlined above. There are currently no plans to change this design or behaviour.

The Global account and Sub account named "SAP Cloud ALM" are intended only for use with the SAP Cloud ALM Product.
You cannot subscribe to any additional SAP products or applications using the Sub account, it is set up exclusively for SAP Cloud ALM.
You also cannot subscribe to any non-SAP Cloud ALM services using the Sub accounts in the "SAP Cloud ALM" Global account. 

Q: During activation we followed the advice within the wizard an have given unique subdomain-name ending with -cloudalm.
Is it possible to map a Custom Domain and where is it to be configured within CALM?

A: 3658235 - Changing the name/sub domain of an SAP Cloud ALM tenant

It's currently not possible to change or rename the subdomain of an existing SAP Cloud ALM tenant.

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Understanding DORA: A DevOps Guide for Side-by-Side Extension Developers
entry.content:
This blog is intended for developers who are developing side-by-side extensions to keep in mind the DORA metrics to be taken care of in design, development, deployment, and recovery strategies to ensure high performance and reliability across your BTP systems.

What is DORA?

DORA stands for DevOps Research and Assessment, a framework developed by Google to measure software delivery performance. It’s based on years of research and real-world data from thousands of engineering teams. DORA identifies four key metrics that correlate strongly with high-performing software teams:

  1. Deployment Frequency
  2. Lead Time for Changes
  3. Change Failure Rate
  4. Mean Time to Restore (MTTR)

These metrics help teams understand how efficiently and reliably they deliver software—and where they can improve.

The Four DORA Metrics

  1. Deployment Frequency

    • How often code is deployed to production.
    • High-performing teams deploy multiple times per day.

  2. Lead Time for Changes

    • Time from code commit to production deployment.
    • Elite teams achieve this in under an hour.

  3. Change Failure Rate

    • Percentage of deployments that cause failures.
    • Lower rates indicate better stability and testing.

  4. Mean Time to Restore (MTTR)

    • Time taken to recover from a failure.
    • Elite teams restore service in less than an hour.

Benefits of DORA

  • Objective Measurement: Tracks performance with real data.
  • Continuous Improvement: Helps teams identify bottlenecks and improve.
  • Benchmarking: Compare against industry standards.
  • Collaboration: Encourages Dev and Ops teams to work together.
  • Automation Focus: Promotes CI/CD, automated testing, and observability.

Use Cases

  • DevOps Maturity Assessment
  • Software Delivery Optimization
  • Incident Management
  • Performance Benchmarking
  • Toolchain Integration (e.g., SAP Cloud ALM, Signavio, LeanIX, BTP)

Why DORA Matters for Side-by-Side Extensions

Side-by-side extensions are often developed in parallel with core applications, sometimes by different teams or contributors. This modular approach offers flexibility, but also introduces complexity in deployment, testing, and recovery. DORA metrics help manage that complexity by providing a clear lens into your development and delivery process.

Let’s break down how each metric applies:

1. Deployment Frequency

What it means: How often you release changes to production.

Why it matters:
In side-by-side development, frequent deployments allow you to iterate quickly without disrupting the core app. It also helps isolate bugs and reduce integration risks.

How to improve:

  • Automate your CI/CD pipeline.
  • Use feature flags to release safely.
  • Keep changes small and focused.

2. Lead Time for Changes

What it means: Time from code commit to production deployment.

Why it matters:
Short lead times mean faster feedback and quicker delivery of new features or fixes. This is especially important when extensions need to respond to changes in the host application.

How to improve:

  • Streamline code reviews.
  • Avoid long-lived branches.
  • Optimize build and test processes.

3. Change Failure Rate

What it means: Percentage of deployments that cause failures.

Why it matters:
Side-by-side extensions often interact with shared APIs or services. A high failure rate can disrupt the user experience or break integrations.

How to improve:

  • Invest in automated testing (unit, integration, regression).
  • Use canary releases or staged rollouts.
  • Monitor error rates and logs post-deployment.

4. Mean Time to Restore (MTTR)

What it means: Time taken to recover from a failure.

Why it matters:
When an extension fails, users may lose access to key features. Fast recovery is essential to maintain trust and minimize downtime.

How to improve:

  • Implement robust logging and monitoring.
  • Use rollback strategies or hotfix pipelines.
  • Document recovery procedures and automate where possible.
+-------------------------------------------------------------+
|                         DORA Framework                      |
|                                                             |
|  ┌────────────────────────┐   ┌──────────────────────────┐  |
|  │ Deployment Frequency   │   │ Lead Time for Changes    │  |
|  │------------------------│   │--------------------------│  |
|  │ - Frequent releases    │   │ - Fast code-to-prod time │  |
|  │ - CI/CD automation     │   │ - Streamlined reviews    │  |
|  │ - Feature flags        │   │ - Optimized builds/tests │  |
|  └────────────────────────┘   └──────────────────────────┘  |
|                                                             |
|  ┌────────────────────────┐   ┌──────────────────────────┐  |
|  │ Change Failure Rate    │   │ Mean Time to Restore     │  |
|  │------------------------│   │--------------------------│  |
|  │ - Automated testing    │   │ - Fast recovery          │  |
|  │ - Canary releases      │   │ - Rollback strategies    │  |
|  │ - Error monitoring     │   │ - Hotfix pipelines       │  |
|  └────────────────────────┘   └──────────────────────────┘  |
|                                                             |
|       → Applied to Side-by-Side Extensions:                 |
|       - Modular development                                 |
|       - Independent deployment                              |
|       - Integration with core apps                          |
+-------------------------------------------------------------+

Technologies Involved

Technology Role in Extension
CAP (Cloud Application Programming Model)Backend services, APIs, business logic
SAP Build AppsLow-code/no-code UI development
SAP Build Process AutomationWorkflow orchestration, approvals
SAP HANA CloudPersistent data storage, analytics
SAPUI5 / Fiori AppsRich user interfaces
SAP Build Code - Joule for DevelopersAI-assisted development, productivity boost

Example Scenario: Leave Request Extension

  • Frontend: SAP Build Apps or SAPUI5
  • Backend: CAP service with business logic
  • Workflow: SAP Build Process Automation for approvals
  • Database: SAP HANA Cloud
  • AI Support: Joule suggests code snippets and optimizations
  • DevOps: CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions or SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery

entry.title: How to force planning of semi-finished goods in MRP planning, regardless of available Stock
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working in PP-PI with a 2-level production structure:

  • Finished Goods (FG) are produced in storage location A01.

  • Semi-Finished Goods (SFG) are produced in storage location A02.

I am using the MRP Area concept, and both storage locations (A01 and A02) are assigned to the same MRP Area.

Business requirement:

  • I want to run multilevel MRP on the finished goods (FG) as per standard procedure.

  • However, for the semi-finished goods (SFG), I need the system to always create planned orders during MRP, regardless of whether unrestricted stock already exists in A02.

Question:
Is there a way in standard SAP (S/4HANA) to force MRP to create supply proposals for semi-finished goods in multilevel MRP Area planning, even if stock exists?

Is this possible via configuration (MRP indicators, procurement type, etc.)

Is there any best practice for such a case? 

Thanks & Best regards,

entry.title: Glad to Be Here – SAP Community Introduction
entry.content: I’m Isaac Manuel and I’ve been working in the SAP ecosystem for the past two decades. I’m really excited to join this community and look forward to contributing, learning, and exchanging ideas with all of you.

entry.title: Re: Can we accept pronunciation of SAP as 'sap' rather than S.A.P ?
entry.content:
Hi,

Reading through the topic, it seems the strongest reason is that sap means pig in german.  But why did they name the company as it is?  It's like naming a company PIG in the States and telling people not to call it pig.  Did they have any other special intention?  If it's "System, application and product", it's English.  Is there any german meaning?
One thing is that correcting a customer is rude.  It isn't good to hurt a customer avoiding getting hurt myself.

entry.title: KIT PURCHASE in SAP ERP S4HANA
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

Iam an SAP MM Consultant and I need your help regarding the following client need: 

Some articles are purchased in KIT which is a grouping of components sold together as a single unit, the KIT is  purchased via a single PO, and in the PO we wish to see the list of components, then upon good receipt the stock for each componenet is updated. (Purchased in KIT and stored as component) 

When I did my reaserch I found that this is possible via the Module SAP Is-Retail (KIT Purchase in SAP IS-RETAIL) , this module is not activated for my client

Note : EWM is also not activated for my client

My question is :

1-Is there any other standard SAP solution that allows the purchasing of a KIT that I can explore ?

2- The module IS-reatail is my only option or is there other workaround solution in SAP Standard ?

3- The module IS-RETAIL need a seperate licence ? I can"t just activate it like other SAP standard module ?

Thank you in Advance

entry.title: Advanced valuation - Self-defined grouping rules
entry.content:
Dear SAP experts,

I'm looking for some guidance on advanced foreign currency valuation in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

I've been working with the standard system, but I need to create self-defined grouping rules to handle some specific valuation scenarios. I'm aware of the predefined rules like 0PRE and 0FLB, but I need to know if it's possible to create a custom rule to group items based on criteria beyond the standard configuration.

According to SAP documentationns and this blog, the two standard grouping rules are:

  • 0PRE: This rule is used for cleared open items and groups together all open items cleared by the same journal entry.
  • 0FLB: This rule is used for not-cleared open items and non-open items and groups amounts by G/L account and currency

    Based on SAP help, we got the following definition for "Group ID" and there is a mention of a "Self-defined grouping rule" 

    Could anyone with experience in this area let me know if this functionality exists in the Public Cloud edition? If so, what are the steps or the recommended best practices for creating and assigning these rules?

    Any help or insights would be greatly appreciated.

    Thank you!

entry.title: Re: Not generating a spool output in the background job
entry.content:
sy-batch determines whether an simple list ( textbased and generates spool or an grid gets created ) 

this gets set automatically and the report itself should not be the reason you get no spool.

i suggest checking print parameters ; Report variants; and print settings when defining steps

Cheers, 

Dennis

entry.title: Future-Proofing Procurement: How Trustpair and SAP Are Fighting Vendor Payment Fraud
entry.content:
🚨 The Rising Tide of Vendor Payment Fraud

Fraudsters have evolved—from impersonating CFOs over the phone to deploying sophisticated cyberattacks and AI-powered deepfakes. The most common tactic? Business Email Compromise (BEC), where attackers hijack legitimate vendor email domains to redirect payments to fraudulent accounts.

Manual callbacks and email verifications are no longer enough. As Baptiste explains, “There’s no way to know if the person on the phone is real. You need to trust your data—not your gut.”

🔍 Why Vendor Onboarding Is the Frontline of Defense

Vendor onboarding is the gateway to your organization’s financial ecosystem. If this process is flawed, every subsequent step—from accounts payable to treasury—is vulnerable. Trustpair tackles this head-on by validating vendor data and bank account ownership across 190 countries, ensuring accuracy and security from day one.

Their platform integrates seamlessly with SAP Ariba and other ERP systems, automating validation and reducing onboarding time by up to 90%.

📊 Data, People, Tools: The Fraud Triangle

According to Baptiste, fraud happens when three elements collide:

  • Complex tools that don’t communicate
  • Siloed teams across procurement, AP, and treasury
  • Unverified data that decays over time

Trustpair’s solution breaks down these silos, creating a unified risk cockpit that empowers teams to act on real-time insights. “You become smart because you have a full picture over the entire office of the CFO,” Baptiste notes.

🌍 Global Compliance and Continuous Validation

With vendors spanning continents, compliance isn’t just a checkbox—it’s a challenge. Trustpair connects to local data repositories and banks worldwide, alerting clients to data decay and fraudulent changes. This ensures that vendor data remains accurate throughout the relationship lifecycle.

🤖 AI and the Future of Fraud Prevention

Fraudsters are investing in AI. So should you. Trustpair leverages machine learning to flag anomalies, automate risk evaluations, and scale fraud detection across millions of transactions. Their platform has processed over 15 million bank account validations, delivering zero fraud for 400+ global enterprises over eight years.

💡 Strategic Value Beyond Security

Beyond fraud prevention, Trustpair enhances vendor relationships, streamlines compliance, and supports digital transformation. By integrating with SAP’s suite-first and AI-first strategy, it helps organizations prepare for the future of intelligent procurement.

🔮 What’s Next?

As Baptiste predicts, “Fraud will be everywhere. The future lies in monitoring data across every system, ensuring trust at every step.” Clean data isn’t just a security measure—it’s the foundation for leveraging AI and driving business efficiency.

📢 Ready to secure your procurement process? Learn more about how SAP and Trustpair are partnering to build fraud-proof, data-driven procurement ecosystems.

🎧 Listen to the full episode: The Future of Procurement: Episode 019

🔗 #VendorFraud #ProcureToPay #SAPAriba #Trustpair #FraudPrevention #AIinProcurement #DigitalTransformation #CleanData #FinanceSecurity #FutureOfProcurement

entry.title: Re: SAC Performance Issues - Number of Dimension Attributes
entry.content: (duplicate)

entry.title: Re: SAC Performance Issues - Number of Dimension Attributes
entry.content:
@Alex_B 

I created a POC using a new InfoObject that references the "real" InfoObject, and then I hid some of its attributes. As I remove the "Visible to Consumers" flag from more and more attributes, the number of attributes mentioned in the warning decreases.

However, it does feel a bit unnecessary to create an extra layer of InfoObjects just to eliminate the warning. I would expect the query optimizer to prune unused attributes—especially since they're not consumed in SAC. With a live model, the data could be fetched if SAC determined it was needed.

This change to the InfoObject also impacts analysis authorizations and several other areas. 

Still, at least I now know how to reduce the number of attributes triggering the warning. I haven't yet had time to benchmark any performance differences.

Thank you for your input.

MEA+PD+WD:4+MMT:2070'

entry.title: Re: How to use latest QUnit and sinon to test your SAPUI5 applications
entry.content:
@ansgar_lichter thanks for this blog post.

To protect your tests against confusing runtime error messages, you should add sinon as additional dependency in your

ui5-tooling-modules-middleware (see ui5-tooling-modules README and search for additionalDependencies). In your sample case, it works fine because you don't have any other third-party packages required at application runtime. In my case, I have this scenario. If I start the dev server and boot the application before executing the tests, the ui5-tooling-modules bundle is created, but without sinon. This means sinon.js cannot be used, and your tests will fail. If your Tests run in parallel e.g. CI Pipeline this could be a very frustrating issue. 
Error Message:  

 

Solution: 
 
Hope This Helps 🙂

entry.title: Re: Organizational model: how to transport with program RHMOVE30
entry.content:
QUESTION:

I select the variant plan "01" and transport but why does it add the data from the variant plan ".:" in the transport request?

ANSWER:

I have debugged the program and I have understood that it's normal. In the transport request, the data in table HRP1217 of the plan variant ".:" is updated with the data from the selected plan variant (01 in my case), and so except the "incorrect" plan variant all the other values are correct in the transport request:

What's important is that during the import of the transport request, the data will be written to the plan variant which is active in the import client. The logic is done by the post import function module RH_ACTIVATE_PDOBJECT_AFTER_IMP (the one defined for the object PDST_BASE, as you can see in the transaction SOBJ, for the "AFTER_IMP" method).

entry.title: Moregraph: Metadata-driven Enterprise Architecture using Conceptual Structures
entry.content:
I'm excited to share my latest publication, which covers Enterprise Architecture, Technical Debt, Metadata, Data Objects, Clean Core, Business Data Graphs, and SAP Graph.

Title: Moregraph: Metadata-driven Enterprise Architecture using Conceptual Structures
URL (also on LinkedIn)
Abstract: Enterprise Architecture (EA) enables organisations to articulate their business purpose, from strategy to execution, without incurring technical debt. Data infrastructures underpin their EA, enabling organisations to derive their purpose from their data landscape. Metadata, a crucial aspect of this infrastructure, is a human construct that gives meaning to the data and shapes the organisation’s EA. The data objects referenced by metadata, however, are usually encapsulated inside applications. The Moregraph application visualises the data objects and their relations, unrestricted by application boundaries, thus allowing the data objects to express their semantics directly at a more precise level of granularity. Conceptual Graphs are used to maintain the requirements for Moregraph’s conceptual structure, which is then implemented using SAP Graph to access the data objects in SAP Business Accelerator Hub. As these data objects are clean core, they can be extended or compared by organisations to address their technical debt at the same level of granularity, with further opportunities for application and Application Programming Interface (API) rationalisation. From these experiences alongside SAP as the representative case study, Moregraph advances metadata-driven enterprise architecture and informs the direction of future work.

Let me know what you think. Thanks!

entry.title: Re: Working with Internal Tables, Parallel cursor, Control Break Statements, Messages
entry.content:
15 years ago, we had so many blog posts of this kind. It's so old that I don't have the courage to search and paste all similar blog posts.

For information, the huge size of the text font in your screenshots relatively to the rest of the text makes it very difficult to read your post (I'm always zooming in and out, so I just stopped reading it).

So, I recommend that you edit your blog post to resize the screenshots.

Other information:

ON CHANGE OF is obsolete (error prone) in today ABAP 7.58.

WRITE and MESSAGE don't exist in ABAP Cloud (except MESSAGE INTO).

Except if huge optimization is needed, "parallel cursor" is an obsolete algorithm, nowadays you can use the internal tables of type "SORTED" and simply use LOOP AT WHERE key1 = ... There's a little overhead because at each new loop there's a repositioning, but it's much more legible than the parallel cursor algorithm.

Concerning the other AT group level processing, I don't use it any more because I consider it to be error prone, and instead we can use LOOP AT ... GROUP BY or GROUP BY in the constructor expressions. Maybe SAP has the same view as me because of the ABAP Cloud documentation: "This syntax is only supported temporarily in the current ABAP language version and must be replaced with valid syntax for that version."

For each discussed topic, a direct link to the official ABAP Documentation would be welcome.

Home page of classic ABAP & RAP: ABAP Keyword Documentation.

Home page of ABAP Cloud: ABAP Cloud - Keyword Documentation

entry.title: Re: How to set the Org Memory Limit for a Cloud Foundry i...
entry.content:
Hi valentincadart,

We have introduced a year back terraform-provider-cloudfoundry and contributed to OSS - Cloud Foundry Foundation. 
The newer v3 APIs have brought several changes to many of the resources created. Some are even deprecated and replaced by different resources. Please refer to our migration guide to help transitioning from the existing community CF provider to the current CF provider. The migration guide highlights the differences and maps to the equivalent resources/datasources as well. 

Regarding your question to set the Org Memory Limit for a Cloud Foundry instance, refer to the documentation of cloudfoundry_org_quota resource highlighting on the sample below.

terraform {
  required_providers {
    cloudfoundry = {
      source = "cloudfoundry/cloudfoundry"
    }
  }
}
provider "cloudfoundry" {}

resource "cloudfoundry_org_quota" "org_quota" {
  name                     = "tf-test-do-not-delete"
  allow_paid_service_plans = true
  instance_memory          = 2048
  total_memory             = 51200
  total_app_instances      = 100
  total_routes             = 50
  total_services           = 200
  total_service_keys       = 120
  total_private_domains    = 40
  total_app_tasks          = 10
  total_route_ports        = 5
  total_app_log_rate_limit = 1000
  orgs = [
    "ba10cc63-cc43-46b1-a00c-5f2a0d7d992e",
  ]
}

output "guid" {
  value = resource.cloudfoundry_org_quota.org_quota.id
}

entry.title: How to pre-create the packages for the ABAP Flight Reference Scenario
entry.content:
Introduction

Several customers ran into an error when trying to import the ABAP Flight Reference Scenario using the abapGit plugin as described in this question abapGit plug-in to import the ABAP Flight Referenc... - SAP Community

As mentioned by a user in GitHub there is a workaround available by manually creating the packages before pulling the content of the GitHub repository of the ABAP Flight Reference Scenario .

Since this is a tedious and error-prone procedure I decided to provide a class in the Z-namespace that can be created in a package in the software component ZLOCAL that creates all the packages which can be run by simply pressing F9.

How to section

  1. Create a package, e.g. ZCREATE_DMO_PACKAGES with ZLOCAL as its super package.
  2. Create a class zcl_create_dmo_packages in that package.
  3. Replace the code of that class with the source code shown below.
  4. Run the class via pressing F9.

Result

Coding explained

The class starts by retrieving the names of the packages, their super packages and their descriptions using method get_package_information( ).

It also retrieves a transport that is needed for the software component /DMO/SAP according to the settings.

For each package it is being checked if it already exists, so that the class can be run several times in case something goes wrong.

Using the boolean constant value create_packages (which is set to abap_true) it is managed whether the method create_package_in_dmo_sap( ) is actually being called. 

The creation of packages and the retrieval of information needed is done by using the XCO libraries that allow access to various functionalities in ABAPCloud. (XCO Library | SAP Help Portal)

 

Sourcecode - zcl_create_dmo_packages

CLASS zcl_create_dmo_packages DEFINITION
  PUBLIC
  FINAL
  CREATE PUBLIC .

  PUBLIC SECTION.

    INTERFACES if_oo_adt_classrun .
  PROTECTED SECTION.
  PRIVATE SECTION.

    CONSTANTS : co_dmo_sap_package TYPE if_xco_cp_gen_devc_s_fo_proper=>tv_software_component VALUE '/DMO/SAP',
                test_string        TYPE string VALUE '',
                create_packages    TYPE abap_boolean VALUE abap_true.



    TYPES : BEGIN OF t_dmo_packages,
              package_name       TYPE sxco_package,
              super_package_name TYPE sxco_package,
              short_description  TYPE if_xco_cp_gen_devc_s_form=>tv_short_description,
            END OF t_dmo_packages.

    TYPES tt_dmo_packages TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF t_dmo_packages WITH DEFAULT KEY.

    DATA dmo_package TYPE t_dmo_packages.
    DATA dmo_packages TYPE tt_dmo_packages.
    DATA transport_request TYPE sxco_transport.


    METHODS create_package_in_dmo_sap IMPORTING
                                                i_transport          TYPE sxco_transport
                                                I_package_name       TYPE sxco_package
                                                i_super_package_name TYPE sxco_package
                                                i_short_description  TYPE if_xco_cp_gen_devc_s_form=>tv_short_description OPTIONAL
                                      EXPORTING findings             TYPE sxco_t_gen_o_findings
                                                exception_text       TYPE string.

    METHODS get_package_information RETURNING VALUE(r_dmo_packages) TYPE tt_dmo_packages.

    METHODS create_transport      RETURNING VALUE(lo_transport) TYPE sxco_transport.

    METHODS create_put_operation RETURNING VALUE(r_put_operation) TYPE REF TO if_xco_cp_gen_devc_d_o_put.


ENDCLASS.



CLASS zcl_create_dmo_packages IMPLEMENTATION.


  METHOD if_oo_adt_classrun~main.

    transport_request = create_transport( ).

    dmo_packages = get_package_information( ).

    LOOP AT dmo_packages INTO dmo_package.

      dmo_package-package_name = dmo_package-package_name && test_string.

      "super package /dmo/sap must not be changed
      IF dmo_package-super_package_name <> co_dmo_sap_package.
        dmo_package-super_package_name = dmo_package-super_package_name && test_string.
      ENDIF.

      DATA(dmo_flight_package) = xco_cp_abap_repository=>object->devc->for( dmo_package-package_name  ).
      out->write( |check package { dmo_package-package_name }| ).

      IF dmo_flight_package->exists(  ) = abap_true.
        out->write( | package { dmo_package-package_name } does exist| ).
      ELSE.
        out->write( | package { dmo_package-package_name } does not exist| ).
        IF create_packages = abap_true.
          out->write( | create package { dmo_package-package_name } | ).

          create_package_in_dmo_sap(
            EXPORTING
             i_transport          = transport_request
             i_package_name       = dmo_package-package_name
             i_super_package_name = dmo_package-super_package_name
             i_short_description  = dmo_package-short_description
            IMPORTING
             findings             = DATA(findings)
             exception_text       = DATA(exception_text)
           ).
          IF findings IS NOT INITIAL.
            out->write( 'Findings:' ).
            out->write( findings ).
          ENDIF.
          IF exception_text IS NOT INITIAL.
            out->write( |exception occured  { exception_text } | ).
          ENDIF.
        ELSE.
          out->write( | demo mode | ).
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.

    ENDLOOP.



  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD create_package_in_dmo_sap.

    DATA put_operation TYPE REF TO if_xco_cp_gen_devc_d_o_put.
    put_operation = create_put_operation( ).

    DATA short_description TYPE if_xco_cp_gen_devc_s_form=>tv_short_description.
    IF i_short_description IS NOT INITIAL.
      short_description = i_short_description.
    ELSE.
      short_description = i_package_name.
    ENDIF.
    TRY.
        DATA(lo_specification) = put_operation->add_object( i_package_name )->create_form_specification( ).
        lo_specification->set_short_description( short_description ).
        lo_specification->properties->set_super_package( i_super_package_name )->set_software_component( co_dmo_sap_package ).
        DATA(lo_result) = put_operation->execute( ).
        " handle findings
        DATA(lo_findings) = lo_result->findings.
        findings = lo_findings->get( ).
      CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(generation_exception).
        exception_text = generation_exception->get_text(  ).
    ENDTRY.



  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD get_package_information.
    r_dmo_packages = VALUE #(
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' super_package_name = '/DMO/SAP' short_description = 'Flight Reference Scenario' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_COLLDRAFT' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: Collaborative Draft' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_DRAFT' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description = 'Flight Reference Scenario: Draft Guide'
    )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description =
    'Hiearchy Guides' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY_DRAFT' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY' short_description =
    'Hierarchy: Draft' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY_DRAFT_D' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY_DRAFT' short_description =
    'Hierarchy: Draft: Data Generator' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY_RO' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY' short_description =
    'Hierarchy: Read Only' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY_RO_D' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_HIERARCHY_RO' short_description =
    'Hierarchy: Read Only: Data Generator' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_LEGACY' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: Legacy Objects' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_MANAGED' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: TX managed E2E Guide' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_READONLY' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: Read-Only E2E Guide' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description = 'Flight Reference Scenario: Reused Entities'
    )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: Agency' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_CNTRY' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY' short_description =
    'Agency Extension: Country (Behavior Extensibility)' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_DATGN' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY' short_description =
    'Agency Extension: Data Generator' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_REV' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY' short_description =
    'Agency Extension: Review (Node Extensibility)' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_REV_A' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_REV' short_description
    = 'Agency Extension: Review - Average' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_REV_D' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_REV' short_description
    = 'Agency Extension: Derived Events' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_REV_E' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_REV' short_description
    = 'Agency Extension: Events for Review' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY_SLOGN' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_AGENCY' short_description =
    'Agency Extension: Slogan (Field Extensibility)' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_CARRIER' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: Carrier' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE_SUPPLEMENT' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: Supplement' )
    ( package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT_UNMANAGED' super_package_name = '/DMO/FLIGHT' short_description =
    'Flight Reference Scenario: TX unmanaged E2E Guide' )
     ).
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD create_put_operation.
    DATA(environment) = xco_cp_generation=>environment->dev_system( transport_request  )  .
    r_put_operation = environment->for-devc->create_put_operation( ).
  ENDMETHOD.
  METHOD create_transport.
    "create transport for /dmo/sap if needed or not (whether software component /DMO/SAP is of type 'K' or 'J')
    DATA(ls_package) = xco_cp_abap_repository=>object->devc->for( co_dmo_sap_package  ).
    IF ls_package->read( )-property-record_object_changes = abap_true.
      DATA(lv_transport_layer) = ls_package->read( )-property-transport_layer->value.
      DATA(lv_transport_target) = ls_package->read( )-property-transport_layer->get_transport_target( )->value.
      DATA(lo_transport_request) = xco_cp_cts=>transports->workbench( lv_transport_target )->create_request( '#Generated RAP110 tutorial transport request' ).
      lo_transport = lo_transport_request->value.
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.


ENDCLASS.

entry.title: Is there a way to validate content files between two different iContent servers?
entry.content:
Hi,

Recently we did a cloning of Learning system from our legacy SF system to a new SF system. Along with that we also cloned the contents in the legacy iContent server to the new iContent server. However as we were checking we found out that some content files might have been lost in the process of cloning but we are not sure of the number of files that has been missing.

So is there a way to compare / check the content files between the legacy iContent server and the new iContent server so that we can figure out how many content files has been lost in cloning and their related details.

Any quick help / resolution would be appreciated.

entry.title: Re: SAP Business One Version Upgrade on Cloud Control Center
entry.content:
Dear SurangaWe,
 
Firstly please upgrade your SAP Business One Cloud to the latest 1.1 PL21. See SAP Note 1756002 - Verified Combinations of SAP Business One Cloud and SAP Business One for your reference.
 
You cannot upgrade an existing service unit to run a later version of SAP Business One. Instead, you must create a new service unit with the SAP Business One version that you want to run.

See following chapters from Administrator's Guide - SAP Business One Cloud:

11.4 Upgrading Service Units
7.1 Creating Service Units

Thank you.

Kind regards,
Ladislav
SAP Support

I have a question about debugging.

The breakpoints are not triggered when I click on "Submit" in the EDocument Cockpit :

When is the method if_edoc_adaptor_cloud~set_output_data triggered ? When you click "Submit" for a Billing Document ?

I'm developing in the 080-client (Development), but I'm running the EDocument Cockpit in the 100-client (Customizing). Can that be an issue ?

Many thanks

 

Hans

entry.title: Re: Need help regarding the error: "You cannot make an as...
entry.content:
Hello

What is your material type?

If you are creating a production/process order with reference to a sales order or WBS with valuated special stock, but you have a non-valuated material, error message CO684 is triggered.

If it's a custom material type, in the customizing transaction OMS2, make sure that your material type is valuated. You can do that choosing the option "In all valuation areas" or choosing the option "By valuation area" and setting the value update on the subcreen.

Regards,
Caetano
